CatDescriptText: Carl Armstrong, steel worker, North Side was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column, published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 20, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Do you think that Negroes today, in Pittsburgh, are prone to follow Negro leadership in politics or do they consider it ineffective?  What do you think about their attitude nationally?" Carl Armstong's answer reads: The majority is prone to follow leadership locally.  And I think this is true, also, on the national level...."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Carl Armstrong wearing light colored coat, moustache, and hat, standing on sidewalk with street, automobiles, and buildings in background; Portrait of man wearing flecked jacket and cap, standing on sidewalk with street, car, and buildings in background
